item.title: üñ•Ô∏è Hosting WordPress on AWS EC2
item.description:
This project documents how I hosted a WordPress blog on an AWS EC2 instance using the free tier. I manually set up Apache, PHP, MariaDB, and WordPress on an Amazon Linux 2023 instance.

‚úÖ Tools Used

  • AWS EC2 (Amazon Linux 2023)
  • PuTTY (SSH client)
  • WordPress
  • Apache, PHP, MariaDB

üîß 1. Launch EC2 Instance

  • Chose Amazon Linux 2023
  • Instance type: t2.micro
  • Set key pair (used later for SSH)
  • Placed EC2 in a public subnet with auto-assigned public IP
  • Security group rules: -Allow SSH (port 22) from your IP -Allow HTTP (port 80) from anywhere

üîë 2. SSH into EC2 Instance Using PuTTY:

item.title: üåê Hosting a Static Website on AWS S3
item.description:
üìù Project Overview
In this project, I deployed a fully functional static website using Amazon S3 (Simple Storage Service). This task introduced me to cloud-based storage, object permissions, and static site hosting‚Äîcore skills for cloud computing and web deployment.

üéØ Objectives

  • Learn how to create and configure an S3 bucket
  • Upload and serve static content (HTML, CSS)
  • Set object-level permissions for public access
  • Enable static website hosting on S3

üõ†Ô∏è Tools & Technologies
